instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP1V8_S5: What is PP1V8_S5? PP1V8_S5 is a 1.8v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power on
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no power. Client says that it just stoped working.

It has 19.8V on ampmeter, and 0.05A ~ 0.01A. It seams to be rebooting and I can't see no corrosion on the board.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.60V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_GPU</SIGNAL> = 12.60V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> = 3.381V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_T</SIGNAL> = 3.357V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5</SIGNAL> = 0V

Already tried DFU but it isen't recognized.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power on
threads.message: Check if <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> delivers expected SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages.
